did.unittitle: John Muir collection of the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn
did.abstract: Collection consists of visual materials pertaining to Williamsburg, Brooklyn, dating from 1880 to the 1980s.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Many items which were part of the original accession were separated from these items. They include two picture cards; seven trade cards and flyers; two Piano Manufacturer's song sheets; a Lee Avenue Academy of Music Programme, 1890; Amphion Theater programme and ticket stubs, 1897; United Boy's Brigade of America, Annual Memorial Service booklet, 1911; 46th Anniversary Parade, Eastern District Sabbath Schools of Brooklyn Sunday School Union booklet, 1907; and legal documents pertaining to William H. Meyers, 1851-1878. These items may have been incorporated into existing collections at the Brooklyn Historical Society at some point in the past.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); John Muir collection of the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, 1994.009, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photographs and postcard are in the public domain. Clippings will enter the public domain 120 years from publication date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of visual materials pertaining to Williamsburg, Brooklyn, dating from 1880 to the 1980s. These include: an 1880 photograph of 87 Bedford Avenue (Kings County Fire Insurance Company); an 1882 photograph of 84 Bedford Avenue (Burgess florist shop and The Hat Box); print of an 1888 photograph documenting an explosion at Stover's Department Store (at Bedford Avenue and South 6th Street); a postcard featuring the Ross Street Presbyterian Church; and documentation of the fountain at Bedford Avenue and Division Avenue, including two small photographs (circa 1891), and two clippings (circa 1960s and 1980s).
